title: Wapfika
author: Wapfika
content: Why does there's a captcha when I'm only using my mobile phone to login here in the forum while there's no captcha when I login using desktop browser. I just notice it now when I browse using my company desktop for the first time. Sometimes the captcha on mobile keeps giving me a result to try again even I'm sure that I'm choosing the right tile. Do you encounter this too on mobile version? It's just annoying sometimes to captcha over and over on mobile because of the small screen.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: When you want to login, you will see a link to bypass captcha. Copy the link and use it anytime you want to login.If I do not use the link to login, I do see captcha. The captcha is not about login on mobile device or computer because on both, I do see captcha.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: I do use both my PC and my mobile phone to login to this forum, and sometimes the captcha shows up when my account gets logged out and I want to log back in. It happens both on my PC and also on my mobile phone. What happens most of the time is that on my PC, which I usually operate using a wifi network that seems to have a stronger network than that of my mobile phone, when I click on verify if you are human or not, it immediately marks that I have passed the test. This happens sometimes too on my mobile. I guess this all depends on how strong your network is and sometimes the IP address from which you are signing in. Apart from this, I have never experienced a captcha before while trying to login to the forum.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Those are depends on your browsing activity on any device, sometimes your ip address also matter, if its flagged as suspicious then you will get more captcha and its annoying. Usually, it happens to me on not regularly used browsers where my commonly used gmails are not logged.To bypass those captcha simply go here[1] and login using the link there.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/captcha_code.php

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on May 31, 2023, 04:02:53 PMThose are depends on your browsing activity on any device, sometimes your ip address also matter, if its flagged as suspicious then you will get more captcha and its annoying. Usually, it happens to me on not regularly used browsers where my commonly used gmails are not logged.To bypass those captcha simply go here[1] and login using the link there.It is better you delete that link, each link is specific to each user and if anyone knows it, hacking your account is easier.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on May 31, 2023, 04:07:15 PMIt is better you delete that link, each link is specific to each users and if anyone knows it, hacking your account is easier. Don't get confused, the link is the access to the captcha bypass link, and not the user or default generated bypass link. The one you are talking has the alphanumeric ccode on it.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Same here when logging in on the PC when clicking the captcha it will confirm right away or it will mark with a check but on my mobile when using a VPN it always asks to captcha even if I did correctly choose images on the captcha it only changes 5 times until it marks as check.You don't need to worry about the captcha if you don't want this annoying captcha then use the link provided by PX-Z its a unique URL where you can log in without a captcha. But be careful do not share this with anyone because it can use to brute-force your account.Why not enable always stay login so that you don't need to keep entering your username and password when you want to visit the forum?

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: Wapfika on May 31, 2023, 03:57:28 PMWhy does there's a captcha when I'm only using my mobile phone to login here in the forum while there's no captcha when I login using desktop browser. I just notice it now when I browse using my company desktop for the first time. To be very honest, i never encounter such a thing, as every time when i login to my account i have to click on the button saying that "i am not a bot" and sometimes it automatically "approves" without filling or giving any imaging test and few times it asks me to give image test. Well, i do have to click on it whether i am at the phone or a laptop. Quote from: Wapfika on May 31, 2023, 03:57:28 PMSometimes the captcha on mobile keeps giving me a result to try again even I'm sure that I'm choosing the right tile. Do you encounter this too on the mobile version? It's just annoying sometimes to captcha over and over on mobile because of the small screen. Well, i also never faced such issue as I often log out of my accounts as i kept them logged in all the time. I think your device must have been tagged with some robotic script or something like that which has made google captcha think that you are a bot. Well, whenever I use VPN for anything on Google (not for BTT) they ask me to fill the captcha and start a captcha loop on me, even after many tries they never let me go forward so what i do is, turn off the VPN and then connect to another server and try again and after giving a first try to captcha, i get approval as human and i can do whatever i want. IDK, what type of work you do on your smartphone which might have tagged you as suspicious one in Google's eye. but still i am no expert in these scenarios I recommend you to read this out too.Quote from: https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/bots/how-captchas-work.This reCAPTCHA test takes into account the movement of the user's cursor as it approaches the checkbox. Even the most direct motion by a human has some amount of randomness on the microscopic level: tiny unconscious movements that bots can't easily mimic. If the cursor's movement contains some of this unpredictability, then the test decides that the user is probably legitimate. The reCAPTCHA also may assess the cookies stored by the browser on a user device and the device's history in order to tell if the user is likely to be a bot.source

comments.author: John Abraham
comments.body: Quote from: Wapfika on May 31, 2023, 03:57:28 PMWhy does there's a captcha when I'm only using my mobile phone to login here in the forum while there's no captcha when I login using desktop browser. I just notice it now when I browse using my company desktop for the first time.  I am not sure if you are using Captcha bypass unique link for your account when you login from your desktop. Other than this, You should have always see a captcha when you try to log in. No matter from what device are you trying to log in. You have to verify the captcha each time you log in. I never had an exception other than the captcha bypass link I use. QuoteSometimes the captcha on mobile keeps giving me a result to try again even though I'm sure that I'm choosing the right tile. Do you encounter this too on the mobile version? It's just annoying sometimes to captcha over and over on mobile because of the small screen. I confirm I face this issue as well. It's freaking annoying. Sometimes Captcha sucks. It asks me to try again over and over even though I choose the correct tile. Not only on the mobile version, but I also face this issue on my desktop as well. I thought it was because of my internet connection. Maybe Google failed to get my data or something like that. As someone already suggested, Do not share your Captcha bypass unique link with anyone. I also suggest not using the Always Stay logged-in feature. In case someone has access to your computer can access your account too if you use always stay logged in.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Captcha bypass code is your choice. Without that code, even you don't use Tor, VPN, you still have issues with captcha. On desktop or mobile, you can use captcha bypass code to log in more easily. Even if you use Tor browser, you will not have problems with captcha.Disadvantage, you have to save that code on your mobile for login.https://bitcointalk.org/captcha_code.phphttps://www.torproject.org/download/#android

This works perfectly now.Quote from: BitMaxz on May 31, 2023, 04:20:34 PMWhy not enable always stay login so that you don't need to keep entering your username and password when you want to visit the forum?I enable always login but my account still being forced logout whenever I close my browser and turn off wifi. Quote from: John Abraham on June 01, 2023, 02:03:40 AM I am not sure if you are using Captcha bypass unique link for your account when you login from your desktop. Other than this, You should have always see a captcha when you try to log in. No matter from what device are you trying to log in. You have to verify the captcha each time you log in. I never had an exception other than the captcha bypass link I use. I’m using a regular link too on my desktop. As Bitmaxz previous comment. The captcha just instantly solved once I ticked the check box without completing the captcha manually on my desktop. I appreciate all the reply everyone. Thank you.
